definition: ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: The modern ice-sports bring more demands to the quality of skates.
sentences.chinese: 冰上運動的發展對冰刀的質量提出了更高的要求。

sentences.english: I have chosen some sports expressions about sports on ice from a dictionary and put them here.
sentences.chinese: 放些冰上運動的詞彙在這，讓我們一起學習吧。

sentences.english: Curling is a nationwide ice sport.
sentences.chinese: 冰上溜石是國際冰上運動。
